sen.e: Kanezane lamented, 'I have never heard of a high priest of Kishu (noble birth) who had such a hardship' ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane) Entry of January 13, 1184).

sen.j: 院御所の襲撃は平治の乱の前例があるが、藤原信頼の目的はあくまで信西一派の捕縛だった。
sen.e: The antecedent of the attack on In no gosho (the retired emperor's court) was the Heiji war but FUJIWARA no Nobuyori's goal was to seize the Shinsei group.

sen.j: 今回の襲撃は法皇自らが戦意を持って兵を集め、義仲もまた法皇を攻撃対象とし、院を守護する官軍が武士により完膚なきまでに叩き潰されたと言う点でかつてないものであった。
sen.e: The attack this time was unprecedented in that the cloistered emperor with a will to fight gathered soldiers himself while Yoshinaka made the cloistered emperor the target of attack, and that the Imperial army guarding the cloistered emperor was knocked into smithereens.

sen.j: そして、およそ40年後の承久の乱に先駆けるものであった。
sen.e: And it was a harbinger of the Jokyu war about forty years later.

sen.j: 11月20日、五条河原で源光長以下百余の首がさらされ、義仲軍は勝ち鬨の声を挙げた（『百錬抄」同日条、『吉記』は21日とする）。
sen.e: On January 11, 1184, with more than one hundred severed heads laid on Gojogawara, Yoshikuni's army gave a shout of victory ("Hyakuren sho" (History book from the Kamakura period) Entry of January 11, 1184; "Kikki" (A diary of Tsunefusa YOSHIDA) recorded the date as January 12.)

sen.j: 21日、義仲は松殿基房と連携して「世間の事松殿に申し合はせ、毎事沙汰を致すべし」（『玉葉』同日条）と命じ、22日、基房の子・松殿師家を内大臣・摂政とする傀儡政権を樹立した。
sen.e: On January 12, working with Motofusa MATSUDONO, Yoshinaka ordered to 'discuss the issues of the society with Matsudomo and take action' ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane) Entry of January 12, 1184), and on January 13, he established a puppet government under Moroie MATSUDONO, a son of Motofusa, as Minister of Palace and kanpaku (emperor's chief advisor).

sen.j: 基房は師家の摂政就任を後白河に懇願して断られた経緯があり（『玉葉』8月2日条）、娘の藤原伊子を義仲に嫁がせて復権を狙っていた。
sen.e: Motofusa had pleaded with Goshirakawa to install Moroie as Sesshu but his plea was turned down before ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane) Entry of August 2), and he had been waiting for a chance to earn restitution by having his daughter FUJIWARA no Ishi marry Yoshinaka.

sen.j: 28日、新摂政・師家が下文を出し、前摂政・基通の家領八十余所を義仲に与えることが決定された。
sen.e: On January 19, the new Sessho Moroie submitted a document issued by a superior or office and it was resolved that Yoshinaka would be given some eighty territories owned by the former Sessho Motomichi.

sen.e: Kanezane wrote about this, "The world is insane" ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane) Entry of January 19).

sen.e: On the same day, forty-three government officials including Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) FUJIWARA no Tomokata were dismissed ("Kikki" (a diary of Tsunefusa YOSHIDA) Entry of January 19, "Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane) Entry of January 20).
